page.title: 08Telephone at Rhenigidale
page.content: This is a radio telephone and the instrument is not in a phone box but in a house. You can't dial your number but instead you ring the operator and tell them your number and they will get you through. If you want to ring Rhenigidale you ring the operator and ask for Rhenigidale 1. The signal is sent from a hut above the village to Gairloch and then to the nearest exchange at Ullapool, through which all our calls in and out come. Mrs Marion Macinnes is the attendant and the telephone is in her house. the operator tells you how much the call costs and the attendant keeps a record of the number and the amount. This money is sent off monthly. The equipment is powered by car batteries which are now charged automatically by electricity but previously these had to be charged by the diesel generators
